title: Ping issues mysterious, and feel like punishment is wrongfully given
body: I was in a game today in league and before playing my ping was at a constant 80-85, I've already taken the precautions of changing DNS to Google, allowing League of Legends through the firewall via Inbound/Outbound rules created, and made certain that no one else was on the internet and no background processes were running before the game. Yet my ping sat at 600 and I was harassed and abused in-game for having 600 ping. All the possibilities I've taken in advance to make certain there would be no in-game issues. And now I get punished/warned for it when I have no control over it and my team threatened to report me for telling them I was 600 ping and was not sure why when previous games were constant 80-85 ping, and speed tested before starting the match it was the same ping. I feel like I've been wrongfully punished as I had no control over the situation and yet I spend my money that I earn on a game where I get punished for that? Seriously? This is ridiculous, I understand it wouldn't be fair to the other players in the game but I took precautions before the game started and I still got punished.. Riot please at least reply or take my punishment off because I wasn't greifing or afking on purpose, I wouldn't be sadistic and do that to other people because I already know what it's like to have someone afk on purpose and it's not fun sitting in a game for 20 minutes or longer because of an afker. Also it has nothing to do with my computer specs because I haven't had issues until today and this one match.

replies.body: If other players are griefing you in-game, use the /mute or /mute all to prevent any further harassment.  I know that the ping issue isn't something you intended, and I'd like to try and help.  Keep in mind that even if it wasn't on purpose, leaving still causes negative experiences for everyone else so [leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) will treat it equally.  I recommend using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help tune up your connection to the game server and fix this for good!  Let me know if you have any questions!
just dont play ranked like that till you get it figured out, ruining peoples elo is not ok, even if not your fault
